channel.title: Academics on Xue Tingkai@NUS
channel.description: Recent content in Academics on Xue Tingkai@NUS

item.title: Before Matriculating
item.description: Before NUS, I studied at Hwa Chong Institution for 6 years, and then I enlisted in the National Service (NS) for 2 years. I have also cleared the following modules. CS1010X Programming Methodology MA1505 Mathematics I EG1311 Design and Make

item.title: Year 1 Semester 1
item.description: ME1102 Engineering Principles and Practice I ME2102 Engineering Innovation and Modelling MA1513 Linear Algebra with Differential Equations MA1512 Differential Equations for Engineering PF1101 Fundamentals of Project Management UTW1001F The Internationalisation of Higher Education Impact and Challenges UTC1702E Thinking in Systems: Energy Systems CFG1002 Career Catalyst

item.title: EG1311
item.description: I cleared this module through a two-weeks course conducted for E-Scholar students. After meeting certain criteria, I was considered to have passed this module. No letter grade was carried on to my CAP. Content This APC course involved lectures and lab. During lectures, we learnt content regarding mechanical, electrical and software. We also learnt how basic components, such as motors and motor drivers, work. For the last few lectures, we got some experience working with Computer Aided Design (CAD) using Fusion360.

item.title: CFG1002
item.description: Coming soon…… Content Assessment General Results:

item.title: MA1505
item.description: I cleared this module through the Advanced Placement Test administered by the College of Humanities and Sciences (CHS). After the test, I was considered to have passed the module. No letter grade was carried on to my CAP. Content The content tested is mostly an add-on to H2 Mathematics. Additional topics include multivariable and vector calculus. More information can be found on the CHS website. Assessment For my year, the test was conducted on Luminus, proctored through Zoom.

item.title: CS1010X
item.description: I have cleared this module under iBLOCS, which is a programme catered to those who have ORDed or are ORDing soon. At the end of this 6 month course, I cleared my CS1010E requirement and earned a letter grade which can be transferred over to my CAP. Content This module taught some basic programming concepts, such as scoping, loops and functions, using mostly Python and a bit of Java. Introduction to CS1010X & Basics of Python Functional Abstraction Good Abstraction and Introduction to Recursion Recursion, Iteration + Order of Growth Debugging Higher Order Function Data Abstraction Working with Sequences Searching and Sorting Multiple Representations Generic Operators Object Oriented Programming Dynamic Programming & Memoization, Exception Handling Introduction to Java Programming Object Oriented Programming with Java The content seems more difficult/heavy than the usual CS1010 courses, but we do have more time to learn too.
